meanings.definition: A short, high-pitched sound or cry
meanings.sent1: The mouse made tiny squeaks as it scurried across the floor.
meanings.sent2: I heard the squeaks of the rusty door hinges as I opened the gate.
meanings.sent3: The baby's cute squeaks always make everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The squeaks of the old wooden floorboards echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent5: The high-pitched squeaks of the bats filled the night sky.

meanings.definition: To make a short, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The puppy squeaks when it wants to play.
meanings.sent2: She squeaks with excitement whenever she sees her favorite cartoon.
meanings.sent3: The balloon squeaks as it slowly deflates.
meanings.sent4: The rusty swing set squeaks with each back and forth motion.
meanings.sent5: The old bicycle squeaks as he pedals down the street.

meanings.sent1: The tiny squeaks of the birds could be heard in the early morning.
meanings.sent2: The wind made soft squeaks as it passed through the small gap in the window.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's sneaky squeaks gave away its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The distant squeaks of the train signaled its arrival.
meanings.sent5: The quiet squeaks of the violin added a magical touch to the music.

meanings.definition: To utter a short, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: She squeaks in surprise when she sees the birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: The rubber duck squeaks when squeezed in the bath.
meanings.sent3: The excited child squeaks with joy at the sight of the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent4: The mouse squeaks in fear as the cat approaches.
meanings.sent5: The rusty gate squeaks loudly as it is pushed open.
